questions.question: What is the main function of stress analysis in piping systems?

options.C: To verify system integrity under various load conditions

questions.question: CAESAR II is primarily used for:
Which standard is frequently referenced in piping stress analysis?
Which of the following is NOT a typical loading considered in stress analysis?
What is one of the key inputs required in CAESAR II for stress analysis?
What does the SIF (Stress Intensification Factor) represent in pipe stress analysis?

options.B: The expansion coefficient of a pipe
options.C: Ratio of maximum stress intensity to nominal stress
options.D: Allowable tensile strength of pipe material

questions.question: According to ASME B31.3, sustained stress should not exceed:

options.B: The sum of hoop and shear stresses

questions.question: Which of the following is a self-limiting type of stress?
What is the correct equation to calculate thermal expansion in a pipe?
Which code appendix contains the Stress Intensification Factors (SIFs)?
What is considered as a dynamic load in a piping system?
Which of the following defines basic allowable stress according to ASME B31.3?

options.A: 1/2 of Yield Strength at operating temperature
options.B: 1/3 of Ultimate Tensile Strength or 2/3 of Yield Strength

questions.question: Which load is not categorized as a static load?
Which figure in the document shows examples of dynamic loads?
Which type of analysis method is typically used for highly critical lines?
What is the first step in modeling a piping system in CAESAR-II?

options.C: Open the software and configure units

questions.question: What coordinate system is used in CAESAR-II to define component position?
In CAESAR-II, node numbers must be:
What input is essential in defining pipe parameters in CAESAR-II?
Which data table in CAESAR-II is used to input design and operating temperatures and pressures?
In CAESAR-II, what is the purpose of assigning insulation/cladding details in the material input section?

options.C: To accurately calculate weight and thermal effects

questions.question: What does the ‘Classic Piping Input’ interface allow you to do in CAESAR-II?

options.B: Model piping components and input physical properties

questions.question: How can a user model a bend in CAESAR-II?

options.B: By entering bend length in DX field only
options.C: By selecting the bend tool and defining geometry in the auxiliary dialogue box
options.D: By enabling the “arc” checkbox in settings

questions.question: Which piping component is modeled by breaking a pipe and assigning a new node in CAESAR-II?
How is a valve typically modeled in CAESAR-II?

options.C: As a rigid with defined length and weight or using the valve flange database

questions.question: What are restraints in CAESAR-II terminology?

options.B: Insulation types for high temp lines
options.C: Supports that restrict movement of the piping system

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid use of a restraint in CAESAR-II?
What is the maximum number of restraints that can be defined per element in the restraints dialog box?
Which of the following is true regarding displacements in CAESAR-II?

options.A: They are used to define corrosion rates
options.B: They are treated as dynamic loads
options.C: They are imposed movements at specific nodes
options.D: They are not considered in piping stress analysis

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of spring hangers in piping systems?

options.A: To support vertical uplift and allow flexibility
options.B: To insulate piping from heat loss
options.D: To add weight to the system

questions.question: What is the purpose of the flange check in CAESAR-II?

options.B: To determine flange leakage under load

questions.question: Flange evaluation in CAESAR-II is based on:
What does the nozzle limit check in CAESAR-II help identify?

options.B: The best vendor for nozzle material
options.C: Whether actual nozzle loads exceed allowable values

questions.question: Nozzle flexibilities in CAESAR-II can be calculated based on which of the following standards?
When using nozzle flex, is it necessary to model the entire vessel or tank?

options.B: No, nozzle flex can be defined directly

questions.question: What are occasional loads in piping stress analysis?

options.A: Loads acting continuously throughout plant operation
options.C: Short-duration loads like wind, seismic, or PSV discharge

questions.question: In CAESAR-II, which auxiliary tab is used to input Forces & Moments?
What is the purpose of Uniform Loads in CAESAR-II analysis?

options.C: To apply seismic or snow loads across the piping system
